Assembly errors: If the assembly of the computer is not done correctly, it may cause functioning problems.
Power supply issues: If the power supply is not compatible with the components used in the computer, it may cause functioning problems.
Overheating: If the computer is not designed to dissipate heat properly, it may cause overheating and damage to the components.
Software compatibility issues: If the computer is not compatible with the operating system or software being used, it may cause problems in the functionality of the computer.
Malfunctioning hardware: If any of the hardware components used in the computer malfunction, it may cause problems in the functionality of the computer.
